Hello everyone. I have recently started completing the course 'HubSpot CMS for Developers'. In the video, they have created a project in local environment using node.js. They have then added personal access token for it and pushed the repository to remote account using the command:

npx hs upload test-theme/src test-theme

However, when I try to push my code using the same command, I get the following error:

Unable to upload "HubSpot\cms_developer_demo\test-theme\src\templates\partials\footer.html". The post to "test-theme/templates/partials/footer.html" in account ****** was forbidden. This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.

 I can see that in the documentation. they have a process to add scopes for oAuth but nothing related to adding  scopes when using personal access token. Is anyone able to help me out with it?
